instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> heavy liquid damage
threads.message:
Board got liquid damage around <CHIP>U7410</CHIP>/20/30 and J8500.
Is there anyway to check if CPU is still fine?

Other damaged area is J5100, <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, UB300.
5V 0A on charger.

Found short (0.003V in diode mode) on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU</SIGNAL>.
Started to remove <CHIP>U7410</CHIP>.. etc one by one and when <CHIP>U7430</CHIP> was removed short gone.

Found short (0.002V in diode mode) on <SIGNAL>CPUGT_PHASE1</SIGNAL>/2/3

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> heavy liquid damage
threads.message:
CPU got overvoltage through <CHIP>U7430</CHIP>.
Don't waste time with this board.
USB-C is also damaged and many chances T2 too.
